Name: ShadowSocks-Server
Overview:
Shadowsocks is a tunneling proxy developed to be free, open-source, and mainly used by Chinese people to bypass the Great Firewall restrictions. While using, it covers your browser traffic only, and it is almost impossible to detect and block it.

The Docker image is:

 --Based on Scratch (no OS) for a total size of 3.53MB
 --Compatible with all the CPU architectures supported by Docker: linux/amd64, linux/386, linux/arm64, linux/arm/v6, linux/arm/v7, linux/s390x, linux/ppc64le and linux/riscv64
 --Shadowsocks is implemented in Go and compiled statically using Go 1.16
DonateText: This app and docker were generously made by qmcgaw. If you like the project please consider making a donation toward his efforts and check out the MANY other projects he has created on GitHub.

@attributes.Name: PROFILING
@attributes.Description:
Enable the Go pprof http server on :6060
** If enabled you must create a port variable to container port :6060
